verses.roman:
teṅho kahe,--eka 'daraveśa' āche dvāre
'tāṅre āna' prabhura vākye kahila tāṅhāre

synonyms: teṅho kahe—he replied; eka daraveśa—one Muslim mendicant; āche—there is; dvāre—at the door; tāṅre āna—bring him; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; vākye—the order; kahila—said; tāṅhāre—unto him.
translation: Candraśekhara replied, "There is a Muslim mendicant." Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu immediately said, "Please bring him here." Candraśekhara then spoke to Sanātana Gosvāmī, who was still sitting beside the door.
